abstracts.cdata!:
This supplemental credit for the Public
            Expenditure Reform Adjustment Credit (PERAC) Project, will
            assist in meeting Benin's increased financing
            requirements, caused by an unanticipated decline in the
            international price of cotton. The absence of this
            supplemental financing would jeopardize the
            Government's ability to keep macroeconomic, and public
            expenditure reform program on track, jeopardizing as well
            the delivery of basic social services. Despite slower
            progress on the structural reform agenda, significant
            progress was registered in critical areas of the cotton
            sector, and budget management reform. The supplemental
            financing would enhance the impact of the PERAC project,
            contributing not only to maintaining the increase in
            allocations to education and health services, but in
            protecting cotton producers' incomes, allowing poverty
            alleviation efforts, through the provision of a subsidy to
            all cotton farmers.
